rationale: The segment contains 'shot up' (vivid verb) modifying prices (economic metric), not a risk-adjective describing the threat's impact.
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.

rationale: Uses the vivid verb phrase "shot up" to describe the increase in prices.
statement_text: By the end of October, US retail prices for female turkeys had shot up 28 per cent year on year, according to US Department of Agriculture data.
